item.title: Comparing Oscar-nominated movies in R using flxr
item.description: In my first post I introduced flxr, a basic R package I wrote to retrieve basic movie data from the web. I showed examples of how a user can retrieve the director of a movie using flxr::flx_mov_director() and other movie details using flxr::flx_mov_details(). I decided to use The Godfather as the movie in my example (because, of course), but I’d like to dig into and compare movies nominated for the upcoming Academy Awards.

item.title: Introducing flxr - an R package to retrieve movie data
item.description: I am happy to say that I’ve created my first R package: flxr. This package is designed to scrape basic data about movies. It can be installed using the devtools package: devtools::install_github("markroepke/flxr") library(flxr) The flxr package retrieves information about movies using only a user-provided movie title. For example, if we wanted to find the director of The Godfather, we could use the flx_mov_director() function: flx_mov_director(movie = "The Godfather") ## Returning movie director for The Godfather: ## [1] "Francis Ford Coppola" You will notice the message above specifying that the director for The Godfather is being returned.
